page.title: 09Local history in Jedburgh
page.content: CASTLE.One of the main castles on the Borders,it was a favourite residence of many Scottish kings .At times it fell into the hands of the English. When a new jail was needed in 1820 it was built on the site of the old castle and was in use for 60 years.It is now open as a museum. ABBEY.Jedburgh's show piece,founded in 1138 by King David,was built by Augustinian Canons from France. They became an important order in Scotland. It suffered much damage from English invaders and was finally abandoned in 1545.The Abbey church was patched up by the townspeople and used as the Parish Church until about 100 years ago.Archaeologists in the past year have been uncovering more remains. Excavations are also being made on the site,near to the High Street,of a 16th cen.Franciscan Friary.
